intro: Eupetalum, commonly known as the meadow cranesbill, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Geraniaceae. These plants are characterized by their showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. They typically have upright stems and are often found in meadows, woodlands, and rocky areas. Eupetalum species are perennial herbs that produce capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. The leaves are usually palmately lobed, contributing to their ornamental value in gardens.
